page.title: 05ECOLOGY 2
page.content: {The Marsh}most of this is well drained controlled grazing and arable land, with some water meadows near the Stour. Once frogs and newts were common in the drainage dykes, but they like the fish have been killed by the use of chemicals in farming. Insects abound and there are foxes, rabbits, hedgehogs moles,voles,rats and mice. The most commonly seen marsh animal is the{hare. Birds:}partridges,pheasants, and mallard ducks are very common as are birds of hedgerow and waterside. However because of the proximity of the coast, and the way North East Kent juts into the North Sea, it is a stop over point or wintering spot for many species. This winter (1985) there is a flock of{Brent Geese.}
